author: Special Correspondent
text:
Collector M. Karunakaran handing over mobile phone to a self-help group trainer in Tirunelveli on Wednesday.

Collector M. Karunakaran handed over ‘Amma’ mobile phones to 556 women’s self-help group trainers at the Collectorate on Wednesday.

Speaking on the occasion, Dr. Karunakaran said that the mobile phones, each costing about Rs. 4,500, had been given to the SHG trainers of Tamil Nadu State Rural Livelihood Movement and ‘Puthuvaazhvu Thittam’ to enable them to maintain their financial transactions.

As the special app installed on the mobile phone was in Tamil, the trainers could use it easily for organising meetings and e-bookkeeping.

“The activities of 23,743 SHGs, having 3,63,564 members in the district, their financial transactions, number of meetings organised, e-bookkeeping etc,. can be submitted through the special app. Besides ensuring constant monitoring, the particulars submitted will ensure timely official intervention,” Dr. Karunakaran said.

MLA Nainar Nagenthran, Lead District Manager S. Alagarsamy, Project Director, Mahalir Thittam, R. Raja Jayabala, Project Manager, ‘Puthuvaazhu Thittam’ S. Bhaskaran were present.
title: SHG trainers get mobile phones
